games

Class Checkers

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.Game
      • games.Checkers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Checkers
extends Game
implements java.util.Observer
    This class implements the game Checkers (also known as Draughts).
    Version:
    $Revision: 0.8 $
    Author:
    Helion

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        private void begin()
        Starts the game. First colors boards and then asks for input from each player until one loses or the game is reset/quit. When a player wins it will ask for a rematch. If it is refused, the game quits

      • canCapture

        private boolean canCapture(int fromX,
                           int fromY,
                           int player)
        Used to determine whether a player is able to capture something.
        Parameters:
        fromX - Piece position X
        fromY - Piece position Y
        player - player 1 or 2 playing
        Returns:
        true if player can capture something by using this piece, false otherwise

      • capture

        private void capture(int x,
                     int y,
                     int capturedplayer)
        Captures the piece at the position determined by the input parameters
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the piece
        y - Y position of the piece
        capturedplayer - player who's piece has been captured

      • checkPlayer

        private boolean checkPlayer(int lastX,
                            int lastY,
                            int player)
        Used to check whether the selected pad contains the designated player's piece
        Parameters:
        lastX - Last X pressed
        lastY - Last Y pressed
        player - Current player
        Returns:
        true if it is

      • colorBoard

        private void colorBoard()
        Colors the board and sets the initial values on the internal 2D array

      • continueCapture1

        private void continueCapture1(int lastX,
                              int lastY)
        Method called when player 1 can capture multiple another piece immediately after playing
        Parameters:
        lastX - X location of the player 1's piece
        lastY - Y location of the player 1s piece

      • continueCapture2

        private void continueCapture2(int lastX,
                              int lastY)
        Method called when player 2 can capture multiple another piece immediately after playing
        Parameters:
        lastX - X location of the player 2's piece
        lastY - Y location of the player 2's piece

      • delay

        private static void delay(int value)
        Returns after a given delay value in ms
        Parameters:
        value - delay duration

      • disablelightControls

        public void disablelightControls()
        Disables all blinking control lights

      • displayRemaining

        private void displayRemaining()
        Displays the remaining amount of pieces available to every player

      • displayStatusOnConsole

        public void displayStatusOnConsole()
        Used for debugging: Displays the current checkerboard's status on the console. Will display . for unreacheable slots, 0 for empty and available slots, 1 for player 1 regular pieces, 2 for player 2 regular pieces, 3 for player 1 king pieces, 4 for player 2 king pieces.

      • fillPlayer1

        private void fillPlayer1()
        Colors player 1's pieces and set the initial values on the internal 2D array

      • fillPlayer2

        private void fillPlayer2()
        Colors player 2's pieces and set the initial values on the internal 2D array

      • forceQuit

        public static void forceQuit()
        Forcefully quits the game

      • inPlayer1

        private void inPlayer1()
        Asks player 1 to play.

      • inPlayer2

        private void inPlayer2()
        Asks player 2 to play

      • isCommand

        private boolean isCommand(int x,
                          int y)
        Returns true if the pad located by the given parameters is a Command pad, meaning not part of the game area
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        Returns:
        True if the pad is a Command pad, False otherwise

      • isEnemy

        private boolean isEnemy(int x,
                        int y,
                        int player)
        Returns true if the pad at X and Y locations given is enemy to the player given
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        player - Player we're checking for
        Returns:
        true if the [x][y] is a piece of the other player

      • isKing

        private boolean isKing(int x,
                       int y)
        Returns true if the piece located by the given parameters is a King piece
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        Returns:
        True if the piece is King, false otherwise

      • isLegalKingMove

        private boolean isLegalKingMove(int movetoX,
                                int movetoY,
                                int lastX,
                                int lastY,
                                int player)
        Checks if the player is allowed to move to the designated location from his initial location. This method is used for king pieces.
        Parameters:
        movetoX - X location coming from
        movetoY - Y location coming from
        lastX - X location going to
        lastY - Y location going to
        player - Player moving
        Returns:
        True if the move is legal, false otherwise

      • isLegalMove

        private boolean isLegalMove(int x,
                            int y,
                            int player)
        Checks if the location [x][y] is an empty slot and returns true if it is
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        player - Player we're checking for
        Returns:
        true if the pad is empty

      • isLegalMove

        private boolean isLegalMove(int movetoX,
                            int movetoY,
                            int lastX,
                            int lastY,
                            int player)
        Checks if the player is allowed to move to the designated location from his initial location.
        Parameters:
        movetoX - X location going to
        movetoY - Y location going to
        lastX - X location coming from
        lastY - Y location coming from
        player - Player attempting the move
        Returns:
        True if the move is Legal, false othewise

      • lightControls

        private void lightControls()
        Turns on the extra 'settings' lights. [0][0] is used to quit the game [0][1] is used to reset the game [1][8] is used to show if player 2 needs to play [8][8] is used to show if player 1 needs to play

      • movePlayerTo

        private void movePlayerTo(int movetoX,
                          int movetoY,
                          int movefromX,
                          int movefromY,
                          int capturedX,
                          int capturedY,
                          int player,
                          boolean isKing,
                          boolean hasCaptured)
        Move selected player's piece to designated location based on input parameters
        Parameters:
        movetoX - X location going to
        movetoY - Y location going to
        movefromX - X location coming from
        movefromY - Y location coming from
        capturedX - X location of captured piece if any
        capturedY - Y location of captured piece if any
        player - The player making the move
        isKing - True if the piece moved is a King
        hasCaptured - True if the player has captured a piece

      • outOfBounds

        private boolean outOfBounds(int x,
                            int y)
        Returns true if the pad located by the given parameters is not in the game area
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        Returns:
        True if the pad is in the game area, False otherwise

      • playerwon

        private void playerwon(int winner)
        If a player has won, blink a specific pad and clear all the slots that don't contain the winning player's pieces. This is just to show the remaining player's pieces' positions since it looks nice
        Parameters:
        winner - Winning player (1 or 2)

      • quitGame

        public static void quitGame()
        Quits the game. Clears the pads and resets the Launchpad to it's normal "out of game" status. It should be ready to be used for other games or animations after.

      • quitGameQuery

        public void quitGameQuery()
        Asks players to confirm if they want to quit the game or not. Blinks the Quit pad (arrow up) while waiting for an answer. Tapping the quit pad confirms a rematch. Tapping any other pad cancels the rematch.

      • recolorBoard

        private void recolorBoard()
        Colors the board again in case a color failed to properly display on the launchpad

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Initializes Launchpad settings and sets initial variables for the game
        Specified by:
        resetGame in class Game

      • resetGameQuery

        public void resetGameQuery()
        Asks players to confirm if they want to reset the game or not Blinks the Reset pad (arrow down) while waiting for an answer. Tapping the reset pad again confirms. Tapping any other pad cancels the reset.

      • restartGameQuery

        public void restartGameQuery()
        Asks players if they want to play another game Blinks the Reset pad (arrow down) while waiting for an answer. Tapping the reset pad confirms a rematch. Tapping any other pad cancels the rematch.

      • retreiveFromDatabase

        public void retreiveFromDatabase()
        TODO
        Specified by:
        retreiveFromDatabase in class Game

      • saveToDatabase

        public void saveToDatabase()
        Saves names and score to database Or will save game status to database so we can resume later on
        Specified by:
        saveToDatabase in class Game

      • setChecker

        private void setChecker(int x,
                        int y,
                        int value)
        Turns on the pad at X and Y given and sets the internal 2D array to the value (representing the piece and player) given
        Parameters:
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        value - piece number. 1 and 3 for Player 1 pieces, 2 and 4 for Player 2

      • showLegalMoves

        private void showLegalMoves(int x,
                            int y,
                            int player,
                            boolean showoroff)
        Shows all legal moves from the X and Y location given for the player given. If showoroff is set to false, it will stop blinking all legal moves available to that pad
        Parameters:
        x - X location of the selected piece
        y - Y location of the selected piece
        player - Player selecting
        showoroff - True if the Legal moves are to be shown, False otherwise

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Initiator for the Checkers game.
        Specified by:
        startGame in class Game

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable arg0,
                   java.lang.Object arg1)
        Not used in this game, but this is called immediately upon receiving an input. We use this to instantly do something if some pad is tapped
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Specified by:
        update in class Game
        Parameters:
        arg0 - Observable
        arg1 - Object
        See Also:
        Observer.update(Observable, Object)
